value.title: DAX Fridays! #113: Unpivot tables with DAX

value.title: DAX Fridays! #: 75: SAMEPERIODLASTYEAR
value.excerpt: In today's video we will go through the DAX function called SAMEPERIODLASTYEAR.  This little function is great for analyzing as the function itself says, the same period last year.  If you have seasonal business and you want to analyze what happended the same period the previous year, it will do it flowless.

value.title: DAX Fridays! #77: GROUPBY, CURRENTGROUP
value.excerpt: In today's DAX Fridays, we will go through the DAX function GROUPBY with an example.  GROUPBY is similar as SUMMARIZE, but the difference is that in the expression part, you use DAX iterators to get your results. You can also nest GROUPBY functions to get for example the highest sales amount by country.

value.title: Combining Tables in Power BI   Union Except and Intersect in DAX
value.excerpt: Power Query is often the engine used for combining data tables, especially using Merge or Append. However, sometimes, you might need to do that operation in DAX. An example of that is when you want to create that combination only virtually as part of a measure calculation that evaluates dynamically.

value.excerpt: Customer retention is one of the most common scenarios of data analysis, which is very useful for business. value.title: Use DAX time intelligence functions in Power BI Desktop models
value.excerpt: By the end of this module, youâ€™ll learn the meaning of time intelligence and how to add time intelligence DAX calculations to your model. These calculations will include year-to-date (YTD), year-over-year (YoY) growth, and others.
